item.title: Apple iPhone 16 is available for 43,850 on Flipkart in just 14 minutes; here’s how you can grab the deal - The Times of India
item.description:
Apple iPhone 16 is available for 43,850 on Flipkart in just 14 minutes; here’s how you can grab the deal

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Times of India

The latest Apple iPhone 16 has hit the market and sold out in record time on Flipkart, going from listing to out of stock in just 14 minutes. This article details how to grab the latest deal.

  • The iPhone 16 is priced at ₹43,850.
  • Stock vanished in just 14 minutes, indicating high demand.
  • Flipkart is offering exclusive deals and offers for early buyers.
“This launch marks another significant milestone for Apple's market presence in India.”

With such a rapid sell-out, the iPhone 16 is set to be one of the most sought-after gadgets this season. Keep an eye on Flipkart for future restocks.

item.title: Garena Free Fire MAX redeem codes for December 25: Win free weapons and skins today - The Times of India
item.description:
Garena Free Fire MAX Redeem Codes for December 25: Win Free Weapons and Skins Today

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Unknown

Players of Garena Free Fire MAX can redeem codes today to win exciting free weapons and skins, enhancing their gaming experience on this special date.

  • Redeem codes available for December 25, 2023.
  • Offers include various free weapons and character skins.
  • Players must enter codes before they expire to claim rewards.
“This is a unique opportunity for players to enhance their gameplay without spending money.”

Be sure to act quickly to take advantage of these free offers available for a limited time!

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Leaks No More? Company Said To Take Strict Steps Against Tipsters To Prevent Spoilers - ABP Live
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Leaks No More? Company Said To Take Strict Steps Against Tipsters To Prevent Spoilers

Published at: 25 Dec 2024 09:29 AM (IST)

Source: Samsung

Samsung is enforcing stricter measures to prevent leaks of information regarding the Galaxy S25 series, following the termination of employees suspected of leaking details. Despite these efforts, ample information about the series has already leaked online.

Key Points:

  • Stricter protocols implemented by Samsung to prevent leaks.
  • Termination of employees accused of leaking details of the Galaxy S25.
  • The Galaxy S25 base model is rumored to feature upgraded RAM and Qi2 wireless charging.
  • A new variant, Galaxy S25 Slim, is expected to be launched.
  • Samsung's measures may impact the broader leak ecosystem.
“While leaks often generate buzz and excitement, they can also pose challenges for companies like Samsung.”

As the launch date approaches, it remains to be seen if Samsung can effectively manage leaks or if they will continue.

item.title: Merry Christmas 2024: Best last-minute tech gifts to order from quick commerce platforms | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Merry Christmas 2024: Last minute tech gifts to order from Zepto, Blinkit and Flipkart Minutes

Date: December 2024

Source: Live Mint

Christmas is here, and if you've been too late in buying gifts for your loved ones, then this tech guide is just what you need! Thanks to quick commerce, you still have time to pick the perfect gift.

Top tech gifts to buy this Christmas:

  • OnePlus Nord CE 4: Available for ₹22,999, features 8GB RAM, 128GB storage, 6.7-inch AMOLED display, 50MP camera.
  • CMF Phone 1: Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 7300 chipset, up to 8GB RAM, expandable storage.
  • OnePlus Nord Buds 3 Pro: Priced at ₹2,733, features ANC, 12-hour battery life on earphones.
  • JBL Wave Beam: Priced at ₹2,299, features Smart Ambient technology, 32 hours battery life.
  • Nu Republic Transform X: Priced at ₹1,499, features ENC support, 60-hour battery life.
  • boAt Stone 1010: Priced at ₹2,499, IPX5 rated, battery life of 10 hours.
  • Portronics SoundDrum: Around ₹1,000, supports FM, 5-6 hours battery life.

These gifts are perfect for anyone who loves technology and would appreciate a thoughtful present this Christmas.

item.title: Poco X7, X7 Pro full specifications leaked ahead of imminent launch: Everything you need to know | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Poco X7, X7 Pro full specifications leaked ahead of imminent launch: Everything you need to know

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Poco is set to upgrade its popular X series with the impending launch of the X7 and X7 Pro. Leaked specifications and design details have provided insight into what to expect from these devices.

Poco X7 expected specifications:

  • Display: 6.67-inch CrystalRes 1.5K AMOLED, 120Hz refresh rate, Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2
  • Processor: MediaTek Dimensity 7300
  • Battery: 5,110 mAh with 45W fast charging
  • Camera: 50MP Sony IMX882 primary sensor, other sensors not yet detailed
  • Rating: IP68 for water and dust resistance

Poco X7 Pro specifications:

  • Display: 6.67-inch CrystalRes 1.5K AMOLED, 3,200 nits peak brightness, Corning Gorilla Glass 7i
  • Processor: MediaTek Dimensity 8400 Ultra
  • Battery: 6,000 mAh with 90W fast charging
  • Camera: 50MP primary sensor with OIS, 20MP selfie shooter

The devices are expected to offer strong performance and innovative features, appealing to users looking for advanced mid-range smartphones.

item.title: Govt plans to introduce new agriculture export policy | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Govt plans to introduce new agriculture export policy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Mint

India's Agricultural Export Policy (AEP) is undergoing significant revisions to enhance its competitiveness and broaden the range of export destinations.

  • The overhaul aims to adapt to shifting export destinations and diversify the agricultural export basket.
  • Key objectives include compliance with global standards and the promotion of value-added agricultural products.
  • Strengthening ties with emerging markets and maintaining relationships with traditional partners are critical focus areas.
“The proposed review will attempt to enhance the competitiveness of Indian agricultural products.”

This initiative reflects India's commitment to adapting its agricultural policies to meet global demands and enhance trade relationships effectively.

item.title: Why do we lose muscle mass with age? Scientists find one factor - The Hindu
item.description:
Why do we lose muscle mass with age? Scientists find one factor

Published: December 25, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

This article explores the connection between aging and muscle mass loss, highlighting recent research that identifies mitochondrial deletion mutations as a significant factor in age-related muscle degradation.

  • Aging leads to deletion mutations in the mitochondrial genome, affecting muscle cell function.
  • The loss of functional mitochondria in muscle cells contributes to muscle mass loss.
  • Research indicates a correlation between deletion mutations and biological aging in humans and rodents.
  • Chimeric mitochondrial mRNA in older individuals suggests accelerated aging processes.
  • The study enhances understanding of how to potentially delay mitochondrial degradation and muscle loss.
“Deletion mutations can affect the expression of normal mtDNA and thus also indirectly speed up mitochondrial loss.”

In conclusion, this research underscores the importance of mitochondrial health in maintaining muscle mass as we age, opening avenues for further investigation into potential interventions.

item.title: Smartphone addiction: Is India facing a digital crisis? | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Smartphone Addiction: Is India Facing a Digital Crisis?

Publication Date: N/ASource: Mint

In India, many adults and youngsters spend nearly a third of their waking hours using smartphones. This addiction has led phonemakers to create features, like Zen Mode from OnePlus, to encourage users to take breaks from their screens.

  • Smartphone addiction affects a significant portion of the population.
  • Companies like Vivo, Oppo, and HMD are developing features to promote digital detox.
  • The rise of digital detox as a business opportunity highlights the growing concern over smartphone usage.

item.title: Late-stage funding revives on the back of pre-IPO rounds; seed rounds struggle | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Late-stage funding revives on the back of pre-IPO rounds; seed rounds struggle

Publication Date: 2024
Source: Mint

Bengaluru reports a resurgence in late-stage funding, particularly seen in pre-IPO rounds, while seed funding remains sluggish.

  • In 2024, 83 Series D and above rounds were recorded, averaging $74.4 million each.
  • This is an increase from 73 deals averaging $71 million in 2023.
  • However, the 2024 figures are still below the peak in 2022, which saw 137 rounds averaging $89.5 million.
  • Mid-market deals also saw a notable rise over the past 12 months.
  • Seed and early-stage investments have struggled to gain traction.
“The trend is likely to continue in the near term as more marquee companies prepare to go public.”

The article highlights a growth trend in late-stage investments while indicating persistent challenges for seed funding, pointing to a shifting investment landscape in India.

item.title: Business correspondents meet Irdai, seek consent to sell insurance products - Business Standard
item.description:
Business Correspondents Seek Irdai's Consent to Sell Insurance Products

Last Updated: Dec 24 2024 | Source: Business Standard

The Business Correspondent Resource Council (BCRC) is advocating for field agents to be permitted to sell insurance products, expanding their role beyond just banking services. This is in response to climate-related challenges impacting vulnerable populations.

  • BCRC requests permission from Irdai for business correspondents to sell insurance.
  • The current role of business correspondents is limited to providing last-mile banking services.
  • There is a growing need for weather-indexed insurance to support those affected by climate issues.
BCRC argues that climate-related shocks disproportionately affect those at the bottom of the pyramid.

This initiative aims to improve livelihood security by offering timely support through insurance payouts based on weather conditions.

item.title: Apple iPhone 15 is available for Rs 26,999 on Flipkart in just 14 minutes; know how to grab the offer - The Times of India
item.description:
Apple iPhone 15 Available for Rs 26,999 on Flipkart in 14 Minutes

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Apple iPhone 15 has become available on Flipkart for an attractive price of Rs 26,999. The stock sold out rapidly, within just 14 minutes of the listing.

  • The iPhone 15 was offered at a significant discount.
  • There was a high demand, reflected in the quick sell-out time.
  • Buyers are advised to check for future sales on Flipkart for similar offers.
“The iPhone sold out in just 14 minutes, showcasing the overwhelming customer interest.”

This event highlights the strong demand for Apple products in the market, indicating continued consumer interest and engagement with the brand.

item.title: Meta’s 2025 vision: Ray-Ban Smart Glasses to get built-in display, report suggests | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Meta’s 2025 vision: Ray-Ban Smart Glasses to get built-in display, report suggests

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Financial Times

Meta is set to enhance its Ray-Ban smart glasses by introducing built-in displays in 2025, aimed at providing notifications and integrating with Meta’s AI technology.

  • The new glasses will offer a more immersive and hands-free user experience.
  • They will provide functions such as navigation directions and enhanced notifications from phones and smartwatches.
  • Currently, Ray-Ban smart glasses utilize audio features for user interaction.
  • Competitors like Samsung and Google are also developing advanced smart glasses.
  • The design will retain a sleek, classic look while integrating advanced technology.
“The addition of a display is expected to significantly enhance user interaction, bridging the gap between fashion and functionality.”

The update could improve Meta's position in the competitive smart glasses market by offering enhanced features that meet consumer demands.

item.title: OnePlus 13 has a new vegan leather, ‘micro-curve’ around flat display, more - 9to5Google
item.description:
OnePlus 13 Features New Vegan Leather and Micro-Curve Display

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: 9to5Google

Ahead of its launch in January, OnePlus has detailed a few more points around the hardware of the OnePlus 13, including a new type of vegan leather and how its flat display isn’t really flat.

  • New “Microfiber Vegan Leather” backplate designed for a natural grip and durability.
  • Flat display features a “micro-curve” for better hand feel and drop resistance.
  • The device boasts a 6,000 mAh silicon battery and IP68/IP69 ratings for water resistance.
  • Balancing design with 50/50 weight distribution for a more ergonomic experience.
  • Launch date set for January 7, 2025.
“Better in your hand than any other phone” - Ryan Ruan, OnePlus' Head of Industrial Design

The OnePlus 13 emphasizes innovative design, sustainability, and user comfort, setting a high bar for the upcoming flagship device.

item.title: Apple App Store exposes children to harmful content despite safety claims, report finds - The Times of India
item.description:
Apple App Store Exposes Children to Harmful Content Despite Safety Claims

Publication Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: Tech News

This report highlights concerns regarding the Apple App Store's ability to protect children from inappropriate content, contradicting the company’s safety claims.

  • The Apple App Store has been criticized for allowing harmful content to be accessible to children.
  • Despite claims of an effective screening process, various inappropriate apps have been reported.
  • Consumer advocates urge Apple to enhance its content moderation policies to safeguard younger users.
"Parents are relying on these platforms to provide a safe environment for their kids, and this report raises significant doubts about Apple's commitment to that responsibility."

In conclusion, the findings suggest a need for immediate action by Apple to improve safety measures in the App Store and ensure a protective digital space for children.

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

“be used to capture data that would be processed by AI and assist people in their daily routines.”

The AirPods Pro 3 is anticipated to push the boundaries of smart audio devices, potentially reshaping how users interact with health technologies.

item.description:
Christmas 2024 Tech Gift Ideas: iPhone 15 Plus, OnePlus Watch 2 and More

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Live Mint

As we approach the joyous Christmas season of 2024, here’s a curated tech gift guide featuring the latest gadgets that are sure to bring delight during this festive time.

  • iPhone 15 Plus

    The iPhone 15 Plus remains a top choice for iOS enthusiasts, available for ₹60,000 after discounts on Flipkart.

  • OnePlus Watch 2

    This smartwatch combines performance and durability, priced at ₹19,999, offering impressive features for outdoor and everyday use.

  • Sony WF-C510 Earbuds

    For audiophiles, the Sony earbuds are a great pick with rich sound quality, priced at ₹4,489.

  • iQOO Z7 5G

    This smartphone is suitable for daily use, offering solid performance at ₹17,999.

  • boAt Stone 1000 14W Bluetooth Speaker

    This portable speaker comes with great sound quality and IPX5 water resistance, priced at ₹2,499.

“These tech gifts are perfect for those looking to embrace the season of giving with some of the latest innovations in technology.”

The holiday spirit is alive and well, making it the perfect time to gift these tech marvels that blend function and fun.

item.title: 2024: a good year for earbuds - The Verge
item.description:
2024: A Good Year for Earbuds

Publication Date: 2024

Source: The Verge

The year 2024 has been excellent for wireless earbuds, with major tech companies releasing competitive models featuring innovative technologies. Users can expect improved functionalities across multiple brands.

  • Leading brands like Apple, Samsung, and Google have released impactful models with notable features.
  • Apple’s AirPods Pro 2 have introduced advanced hearing health features.
  • Samsung's voice controls have been highlighted as particularly user-friendly.
  • New entrants like Nothing have shown strong competition in design and pricing.
  • Jabra exited the consumer earbuds market, marking a significant shift in the industry.
“Apple’s AirPods Pro 2 can now function as clinical-grade hearing aids for people with mild to moderate hearing loss.”

Overall, the earbuds market is evolving with more features aimed at health tracking and seamless integration into user lifestyles.

item.title: Don’t worry, Samsung One UI 7 still has Unified Quick Settings Panel - Sammy Fans
item.description:
Samsung One UI 7 Introduces Unified Quick Settings Panel

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Sammy Fans

The newly launched Samsung One UI 7 brings a redesigned Quick Settings and Notification Panel that users can customize to their preference, including a legacy option for those who prefer the traditional design.

  • The Quick Settings and Notification Panel can now be unified or kept separate.
  • When unified, users will see a single swipe-down access to both panels.
  • Additional customization tools allow users to adjust the toggle arrangement within the panels.
  • New options include changing the visibility of media controls and brightness sliders.
  • The beta version is available for select markets with a public release expected in Q1 2025.
“So if you want to go back to the old style, One UI 7 has the option to help.”

This update provides Galaxy users enhanced control and personalization of their Quick Settings and Notification Panels, keeping the user experience both innovative and familiar.

item.title: Exclusive: OnePlus's head of industrial design on delivering the 'best in-hand feel' with the OnePlus 13 - Android Central
item.description:
Exclusive: OnePlus's head of industrial design on delivering the 'best in-hand feel' with the OnePlus 13

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Android Central

The article provides insights into the design philosophy behind the OnePlus 13, highlighting a shift towards a boxier design while maintaining a focus on improved in-hand feel and durability.

  • OnePlus maintained a consistent design language since the OnePlus 3, prioritizing a great in-hand feel.
  • The OnePlus 13 features a new boxy design and a vegan leather back for enhanced grip and durability.
  • The design team aimed to create the best in-hand feel with a focus on secure grip and durability.
  • The phone includes a flat AMOLED panel with a 2.5D micro-curve ratio to improve touch experience and avoid accidental touches.
  • It utilizes a custom Ceramic Guard for superior drop protection and scratch resistance.
  • The OnePlus 13 will adopt silicon battery technology for improved energy density and durability.
  • The design includes IP68 and IP69 resistance ratings for water and dust protection.
“We worked hard to make OnePlus 13 feel better in your hand than any other phone,” said Ryan Ruan.

This design overhaul signifies OnePlus's commitment to innovation while enhancing user experience with superior materials and technology.
